com.danielvizzini.util
Class IterableUtil

java.lang.Object
  com.danielvizzini.util.IterableUtil

public class IterableUtil
extends java.lang.Object

Kitchen sink of static methods with iterables as parameters. Note that the split and join methods may be deprecated in favor of Guava.

join

public static java.lang.String join(java.lang.Iterable<?> pieces,
                                    java.lang.String separator)
Joins elements of a List into a String, separated by specified separator

Parameters:
pieces - List to join, e.g. ArrayList(Arrays.asList("a", "b"))
separator - String to separate elements of list, e.g. ", "
Returns:
String of list elements joined by separator, e.g. "a, b"

Parameters:

Returns:

split

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> split(java.lang.String str,
                                                          java.lang.String separator)
Splits Sting into ArrayList of words separated by separator
No elements will be "".
e.g. split("a b", " ") returns ArrayList(Arrays.asList({"a","b"}))

Parameters:
str - String to be split
separator - String that marks splits
Returns:
This same string as ArrayList split by separator

split

public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> split(java.lang.String str)
Splits Sting into ArrayList of words separated by spaces No elements will be "". e.g. split("a b", " ") returns ArrayList(Arrays.asList({"a","b"}))

Parameters:
str - String to be split
Returns:
This same string as ArrayList of words

stringsInPhrases

public static boolean stringsInPhrases(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> strings,
                                       java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> phrases,
                                       java.lang.Boolean caseSensitive)
Determines if any strings in a list are in a list of phrases Different than org.apache.commons.collections.CollectionUtils.containsAny() because one phrase must contain a string, not be a string

Parameters:
strings - iterable of words that may or may not be in phrases
phrases - iterable of phrases to be examined
caseSensitive - true if string is matched case sensitively, false otherwise
Returns:
true if any words are in any phrase, false otherwise

stringsInPhrases

public static boolean stringsInPhrases(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> strings,
                                       java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> phrases)
Determines if any strings in a list are in a list of phrases, case insensitively Different than org.apache.commons.collections.CollectionUtils.containsAny() because one phrase must contain a string, not be a string

Parameters:
strings - iterable of words that may or may not be in phrases
phrases - iterable of phrases to be examined
Returns:
true if any words are in any phrase, case insensitively, false otherwise

Returns:

                                      java.lang.String phrase)

Parameters:

phrase - iterable of phrases to be examined
Returns:

wordsInPhrase

public static boolean wordsInPhrase(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> words,
                                    java.lang.String phrase,
                                    java.lang.Boolean caseSensitive)
Determines if any words in a list are in a given phrase. A word is defined as what is between spaces.

Parameters:
words - iterable of words, separated by whitespace, that may or may not be in phrase
phrase - phrase to be examined
caseSensitive - true if words are matched case sensitively, false otherwise
Returns:
true if any words are in the phrase with whitespace on either side, false otherwise e.g. wordsInPhrase(Iterable("a"), "a bear", false) returns true and wordsInPhrase(Iterable("a"), "the bear") returns false, even though "bear" contains "a"

wordsInPhrase

public static boolean wordsInPhrase(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.String> words,
                                    java.lang.String phrase)
Determines if any words in a list are in a given phrase, case insensitively. A word is defined as what is between spaces.

Parameters:
words - iterable of words, separated by whitespace, that may or may not be in phrase
phrase - phrase to be examined
Returns:
true if any words are in the phrase with whitespace on either side, false otherwise e.g. wordsInPhrase(Iterable("A"), "a bear") returns true and wordsInPhrase(Iterable("A"), "the bear") returns false, even though "bear" contains "a"

Returns:

Parameters:
stringList - iterable of possible starting words
examinedString - String to be examined
Returns:
index of first matching element in startArray if matched, -1 otherwise

                                    java.lang.String str)
Parameters:
